Posts.Content: this may not be the place for this question but here goes.im a 39 YR OLD MALE,and i had low testerone.i took one test. injection and felt so much better.took the second one a month later and noticed no difference in how i felt.third one a month later and 2days after injection i had pain in my right breast.it was almost sore to the touch.the dr didnt think it was related to the t-injections but i stopped them and have had no more.the pain is still there after 3months have gone by since last shot.dr gave me a round of anitbiotics that seemed to help a little but it is still tender to the touch.they examined my breast and the one that is sore they say is bigger around where the nipple is under the skin.kinda like a knot there but not really a knot.they seemed concerned about it so i have scheduled a mammogram and a ultrasound to see what is going on.it has me worried to say the least.anybody have any ideas as to what this could be??????
Posts.Title: pain in right breast

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by diane777 It does seem like there is some relation to the shots and getting this symptom even if you still have the pain after 3 months. Breast tissue seems to take a long time to heal, I've noticed after injury so maybe it's similar in this case. I don't want to guess what it could be, but I hope your tests are soon so you can find out. Good luck and please let us know how it turns out. Even if it is the worst thing, you are catching it very early, I think. The reason most men don't do well if they have breast cancer is because they do nothing about a symptom and ignore it until a very long time has passed. You aren't doing that, so I think they odds are in your favor. THANKS for the reply,i agree it seems the t-shots had something to do with bringing this all on.i pray it is nothing.i will let you know how it comes out.
Posts.Title: pain in right breast
